page.title: 15CROUGHTON PARISH COUNCIL 1
page.content: There are 9 members of the council, elected every 5 years. It is difficult to find replacements as members retire or resign. There has not been an election for many years, and new members have to be co-opted by the council. As a parish council is the only non political form of government in the UK, party politics do not enter into discussions. The Parish Council is a very important part of local government, forming a link between the village, South Northants District Council and the County Coucil. Councillors are unpaid, and meet monthly in the evenings at the school. The Parish Council owns and maintains the street lighting, the cemetry, allotments and the children's playground. It owns but does not control the Playing Fields, (where a new pavilion was built this year).
